com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.strategy

Class InterruptibleStrategy<C extends Element>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.strategy.InterruptibleStrategy<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - is the type of Elements to which the Strategy applies.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interruptible, Strategy<C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DependencyStrategy, ParallelStrategy, RandomStrategy, SerialStrategy

    public abstract class InterruptibleStrategy<C extends Element>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Strategy<C>
    This class provides an encapsulation of common implementations for the methods associated with pausing and resuming strategies.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InterruptibleStrategy() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void interrupt()
      A call to interrupt indicates to an Interruptible that it should not continue work beyond the current point, until Interruptible.proceed() is called.
      boolean isInterrupted()
      Indicates whether the object is interrupted or not.
      void proceed()
      A call to proceed indicates to an Interruptible that it should may cancel a previous Interruptible.interrupt() call and resume with any in-progress work.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface com.mesosphere.sdk.scheduler.plan.strategy.Strategy

        getCandidates, getName

        public InterruptibleStrategy()

    • Method Detail

      • interrupt

        public void interrupt()
        Description copied from interface: Interruptible
        A call to interrupt indicates to an Interruptible that it should not continue work beyond the current point, until Interruptible.proceed() is called. This call has no effect if the object is already interrupted.
        Specified by:
        interrupt in interface Interruptible

      • proceed

        public void proceed()
        Description copied from interface: Interruptible
        A call to proceed indicates to an Interruptible that it should may cancel a previous Interruptible.interrupt() call and resume with any in-progress work. This call has no effect if the object is already proceeding.
        Specified by:
        proceed in interface Interruptible

      • isInterrupted

        public boolean isInterrupted()
        Description copied from interface: Interruptible
        Indicates whether the object is interrupted or not.
        Specified by:
        isInterrupted in interface Interruptible
        Returns:
        true if the object is interrupted, false otherwise.
